description: Given a user pool ID, returns user pool groups and their details.

parameters.name: UserPoolId
parameters.description: The ID of the user pool where you want to list user groups.

nested_items.name: Groups
nested_items.description: An array of groups and their details. Each entry that's returned includes description, precedence, and IAM role values.

nested_items.name: UserPoolId
nested_items.description: The ID of the user pool that contains the group.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A friendly description of the group.

nested_items.name: RoleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM role associated with the group. If a group has the highest priority of a user's groups, users who authenticate with an identity pool get credentials for the RoleArn that's associated with the group.

nested_items.name: Precedence
nested_items.description: A non-negative integer value that specifies the precedence of this group relative to the other groups that a user can belong to in the user pool. Zero is the highest precedence value. Groups with lower Precedence values take precedence over groups with higher ornull Precedence values. If a user belongs to two or more groups, it is the group with the lowest precedence value whose role ARN is given in the user's tokens for the cognito:roles and cognito:preferred_role claims.

nested_items.name: LastModifiedDate
nested_items.description: The date and time when the item was modified. Amazon Cognito returns this timestamp in UNIX epoch time format. Your SDK might render the output in a human-readable format like ISO 8601 or a Java Date object.

nested_items.name: CreationDate
nested_items.description: The date and time when the item was created. Amazon Cognito returns this timestamp in UNIX epoch time format. Your SDK might render the output in a human-readable format like ISO 8601 or a Java Date object.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: The identifier that Amazon Cognito returned with the previous request to this operation. When you include a pagination token in your request, Amazon Cognito returns the next set of items in the list. By use of this token, you can paginate through the full list of items.
